definitions: religious ceremony of sharing consecrated bread and wine representing Christ's body and blood
deep spiritual connection and understanding between people or with the divine
intimate sharing or exchange of thoughts and feelings between individuals
examples: The congregation received communion during Sunday morning service
First communion marks an important milestone in Catholic tradition
She felt a deep communion with nature during her mountain retreat
The mystic sought communion with the divine through meditation
Their long friendship created a communion of minds and spirits
The couple enjoyed quiet communion over their morning coffee

definitions: person who believes in or supports communism as a political and economic system
member of a communist party or government in a communist state
examples: Many communists believed in creating a classless society through revolution
The communist argued for collective ownership of production means
The communist party members gathered for their annual conference
Former communists shared their experiences living under Soviet rule

definitions: process of managing and dealing with stress, problems, or difficult situations
protective cap or covering on top of a wall, usually sloped to shed water
examples: Effective coping strategies help students manage exam stress successfully
Her coping mechanisms included exercise and talking with friends
The stone coping prevented rainwater from damaging the garden wall
Workers installed new coping along the parapet's entire length

definitions: reddish-brown metallic chemical element used in electrical wiring and plumbing
reddish-brown color resembling the metal copper
informal British term for a police officer
examples: Copper pipes are preferred for plumbing due to their durability
The electrical industry relies heavily on copper for wiring
Her hair gleamed with copper highlights in the sunlight
The artist mixed copper tones into the autumn landscape
The copper on the beat knew everyone in the neighborhood
Local coppers investigated the burglary at the corner shop

definitions: small group of trees or bushes growing closely together
examples: The rabbit disappeared into the copse at the field's edge
A small copse provided shelter for various woodland creatures

definitions: sexual intercourse between individuals, especially referring to mating in animals
examples: Biologists observed copulation behaviors in the wild bird population
The documentary explained copulation rituals among various mammal species

definitions: exact duplicate or reproduction of an original document, artwork, or object
written material or text prepared for publication or advertising
single example of a publication such as a book or magazine
examples: Please make three copies of this contract for our records
The museum displayed a copy of the famous painting
The editor reviewed the copy before sending it to print
The advertising copy needed more compelling language
I bought a copy of today's newspaper at the stand
She owns a first edition copy of the rare book

definitions: person who copies or imitates the behavior, actions, or work of another
examples: The copycat submitted artwork nearly identical to the original artist's
Children often become copycats when they admire older siblings

definitions: act or process of making duplicates or reproductions of something
examples: Copying important documents ensures you have backup records available
The student was caught copying answers during the examination

definitions: person who makes written copies of documents, especially manuscripts before printing was invented
examples: Medieval copyists preserved ancient texts through careful hand transcription
The monastery employed several copyists to duplicate religious manuscripts

definitions: exclusive legal right to reproduce, publish, or sell original creative work for a specified period
examples: The author holds copyright on all her published novels worldwide
Copyright infringement can result in substantial legal penalties

definitions: professional writer who creates promotional text for advertising and marketing materials
examples: The copywriter crafted compelling headlines for the product campaign
Experienced copywriters understand how to engage target audiences effectively

definitions: marine invertebrate that forms colonies and builds reefs in warm ocean waters
pinkish-orange color resembling coral
hard skeleton of coral used for jewelry and decoration
examples: Coral reefs support incredibly diverse marine ecosystems worldwide
Climate change threatens coral bleaching in tropical waters
She wore a coral dress to the summer garden party
The sunset painted the sky in coral and gold hues
The necklace featured polished coral beads from the Mediterranean
Antique coral jewelry has become increasingly valuable

definitions: length of twisted fibers or threads used for binding or connecting things
flexible insulated cable carrying electricity to an appliance
cord-like anatomical structure such as the spinal cord or umbilical cord
examples: She tied the packages together with a strong cord
The climber checked every cord and rope before ascending
The vacuum cleaner's cord wouldn't reach the far corner
Always unplug the cord before attempting any repairs
The spinal cord transmits signals between brain and body
Doctors clamped and cut the umbilical cord after delivery

definitions: sweet fruit-flavored drink, often concentrated and diluted with water before drinking
examples: Grandmother served elderflower cordial at the garden party
The children enjoyed lime cordial on the hot afternoon

definitions: line of police, soldiers, or vehicles positioned to prevent access to an area
examples: Police established a cordon around the crime scene immediately
Security personnel formed a cordon to control the crowd

definitions: durable cotton fabric with vertical ridges or wales on its surface
examples: His corduroy jacket had worn smooth at the elbows
The couch was upholstered in deep brown corduroy fabric

definitions: central or innermost part of something
most important or essential part of something abstract
central part of a fruit containing seeds
central muscles of the torso providing stability and strength
examples: Engineers examined the reactor's core for any damage
The Earth's core consists of iron and nickel
Trust forms the core of any successful relationship
The core curriculum includes mathematics and language arts
She removed the apple's core before slicing it
The pear's core contained several black seeds
Pilates exercises strengthen your core muscles effectively
Athletes focus on core training for better performance

definitions: small herding dog breed with short legs and fox-like face, originally from Wales
examples: The Queen's corgis were famous throughout the British Commonwealth
Their corgi loved herding the children around the backyard

definitions: aromatic herb whose leaves and seeds are used in cooking, also known as cilantro
examples: Fresh coriander leaves garnished the spicy curry dish beautifully
Ground coriander seeds add warmth to Middle Eastern cuisine

definitions: cylindrical stopper for bottles, traditionally made from cork oak bark
lightweight elastic bark from the cork oak tree used for various products
examples: The waiter removed the cork from the wine bottle expertly
The champagne cork popped and flew across the room
Portugal produces most of the world's cork for commercial use
Cork flooring provides natural insulation and comfortable walking surface

definitions: informal term for something or someone remarkably good or impressive
examples: That final goal was an absolute corker
She told a real corker of a joke at dinner

definitions: spiral metal device used to extract corks from wine bottles
examples: The sommelier used a professional corkscrew with practiced ease
I couldn't find the corkscrew to open the wine

definitions: tall cereal plant producing kernels on large ears, also called maize
small area of thickened skin on the foot caused by pressure or friction
examples: Farmers harvested corn from hundreds of acres this season
Sweet corn on the cob is a summer barbecue favorite
The painful corn on her toe required podiatrist treatment
Wearing tight shoes can cause corns to develop

definitions: type of bread made primarily from cornmeal, popular in Southern American cuisine
examples: Warm cornbread complemented the hearty chili perfectly
Grandmother's cornbread recipe included buttermilk and honey

definitions: transparent layer forming the front part of the eye that covers the iris and pupil
examples: The ophthalmologist examined her cornea for signs of damage
Corneal transplants can restore vision in certain conditions

definitions: place where two lines, surfaces, or edges meet at an angle
remote or secluded area or region
difficult or awkward position from which escape is hard
monopolistic control of a market or commodity
examples: The bookstore stands at the corner of Main and First
She bumped her hip on the table's sharp corner
They discovered a quiet corner of the park for picnics
The cottage sat in a forgotten corner of Scotland
The investigation had backed him into a tight corner
Don't paint yourself into a corner with promises
The company tried to corner the market on rare metals
Speculators attempted to corner wheat futures last year

definitions: defensive player in American football who covers wide receivers and defends against passes
examples: The cornerback intercepted the pass intended for the receiver
Elite cornerbacks can shut down an entire side of the field

definitions: ceremonial first stone set in construction of a masonry foundation, often inscribed
essential element or foundation on which something is based or depends
examples: The cornerstone bears the date when construction began in 1892
Dignitaries gathered for the cornerstone laying ceremony
Trust serves as the cornerstone of their successful marriage
Free speech remains a cornerstone of democratic society

definitions: brass musical instrument similar to a trumpet but with a more conical bore
examples: The marching band's cornet section played the melody beautifully
He practiced cornet scales for the upcoming concert

definitions: field where corn or maize is grown as a crop
examples: The cornfield stretched for miles across the prairie
Children played hide-and-seek in the tall cornfield

definitions: flour made from dried corn or maize, used in cooking and baking
examples: Polenta is made from coarsely ground yellow cornmeal
She dusted the pizza pan with cornmeal before adding dough

definitions: decorative horn-shaped container overflowing with produce, symbolizing abundance
abundant supply or large quantity of something good or desirable
examples: The Thanksgiving centerpiece featured a traditional cornucopia filled with gourds
Classical paintings often depicted cornucopias overflowing with fruit
The farmers market offered a cornucopia of fresh vegetables
The library provided a cornucopia of resources for researchers

definitions: proposition that follows from and is often appended to one already proved or established
examples: The theorem's corollary provided additional mathematical insights
A corollary of economic growth is often increased pollution

definitions: luminous circle of light visible around the sun or moon during an eclipse
crown-like spike proteins surrounding certain viruses, particularly coronaviruses
examples: The solar corona became visible during the total eclipse
Scientists study the sun's corona to understand solar activity
Electron microscopy revealed the virus's distinctive corona structure
The corona of spike proteins enables viral attachment to cells

definitions: relating to or denoting the arteries that supply blood to the heart muscle
examples: The patient underwent coronary bypass surgery last month
Coronary artery disease remains a leading cause of death

definitions: ceremony of crowning a sovereign or sovereign's consort as monarch
examples: The coronation took place at Westminster Abbey with great pageantry
Millions watched the televised coronation of the new monarch

definitions: official who investigates violent, sudden, or suspicious deaths to determine cause
examples: The coroner ruled the death accidental after thorough investigation
County coroners work closely with law enforcement and medical examiners

definitions: small crown worn by nobility ranking below sovereign, or decorative circlet
examples: The duchess wore an elegant coronet at the state dinner
The bride's coronet sparkled with tiny diamonds and pearls

definitions: abbreviated form of corporation used in company names
examples: Microsoft Corp announced record quarterly earnings yesterday
The merger between Tech Corp and Digital Corp was approved

definitions: non-commissioned officer rank in the army, above private and below sergeant
examples: The corporal led his squad through the training exercise
She was promoted from private to corporal after basic training

definitions: large company or group of companies authorized to act as a single legal entity
examples: The corporation expanded operations into three new countries this year
Multinational corporations dominate many sectors of the global economy

definitions: main subdivision of an army in the field, consisting of two or more divisions
group of people engaged in a particular activity or profession
examples: The marine corps deployed to the region for peacekeeping operations
Two army corps were stationed along the northern border
The press corps gathered for the presidential announcement
The diplomatic corps attended the embassy reception

definitions: dead body of a human being
examples: Forensic experts examined the corpse for evidence
The corpse was discovered in the abandoned warehouse

definitions: pen or enclosure for horses, cattle, or other livestock
examples: Cowboys herded the cattle into the corral for branding
The ranch had several corrals for different groups of horses

definitions: action or process of fixing an error or mistake
punishment or discipline intended to reform behavior, especially in prisons
examples: The teacher marked corrections on the student's essay in red
The newspaper published a correction to yesterday's article
The correction facility houses over two thousand inmates
Juvenile correction programs focus on rehabilitation over punishment

definitions: something intended to correct or counteract something harmful or undesirable
examples: The company implemented corrective measures after the safety audit
Corrective lenses helped improve her vision significantly

definitions: thing that has a mutual relationship or connection with something else
examples: Researchers found strong correlates between education and income levels
Depression often has biological correlates in brain chemistry

definitions: mutual relationship or connection between two or more things, especially statistically
examples: Scientists discovered a correlation between exercise and mental health
The study showed no correlation between the two variables

definitions: communication by exchanging letters, emails, or other written messages
close similarity, connection, or agreement between things
examples: Their correspondence lasted twenty years despite living apart
The secretary handled all business correspondence for the executive
There's a clear correspondence between effort and achievement
The correspondence between the two accounts confirmed their accuracy
